body: The bug (regression) is present since the version 3.14.2 (https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/releases/tag/3.14.2)
@muglug this seems to be a recurring theme. I've found 4 more dupes of this issue.

issue.title: query: re templating issues & defining types for import elsewhere

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
it's helpful to be able to import a type so it can be reused elsewhere without having to duplicate & maintain several instances of a type definition.

However, I'm running into some issues when using types with templating:

* works as expected: https://psalm.dev/r/d313b87ccc
* works as expected: https://psalm.dev/r/99ffa74eda
* expected to work (i.e. for T2 be an importable type) but fails: https://psalm.dev/r/328692b52a
* doesn't work but i'm not sure if it should: https://psalm.dev/r/190a61cda8
* works but I'm not sure if it should: https://psalm.dev/r/08c7ea7140
* works but I'm not sure if it should: https://psalm.dev/r/3561d475c1

issue.title: docblock defined type cannot be used in @extends

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
Two use cases of extends: https://psalm.dev/r/8d207f9f2c

First works as expected.
But second is wrong.

issue.title: @template-implements / extends does not recognize custom type definitions.

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
Hi

I would expected that `@type Values` is an acceptable parameter in `@template-implements Test<Values> `

See https://psalm.dev/r/16c5eaff3b

issue.title: Use psalm-type as generic parameter

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.title: Allow @psalm-type and @psalm-import-type to be used in extends/implements

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
Fix #4240

This fixes issues with not being able to use `@psalm-type`s in the same doc-block they're defined in, and allows them to be used for `@implements`/`@extends` type parameters as expected

It's mostly just moving some things around so that it gets the types from the node's comments before carrying on with the rest of the doc-block stuff, and pulls the resolving of imported types into a separate method

body: thanks @muglug - I was looking forward for that üëç
